title: How to Prepare Concrete Before Staining It

steps.headline: Buy some trisodium phosphate (TSP).
steps.description: This chemical is particularly useful for cleaning concrete.

steps.headline: Sweep your concrete floor with a shop broom, gathering up as much dirt and debris as possible.
Scrub your floor with the TSP.
steps.description: Use a rotary scrubbing machine with a special pad designed for the aggressive scrubbing of concrete.

steps.headline: Look for remaining stains, such as those left behind by glues or caulking compounds.
Attempt to scrape any of the glue or caulk off of the floor with a putty knife or floor scraper.
If scraping alone does not work, apply either a nonflammable chemical stripper or a powdered hydrated lime paste to the stained area.
steps.description: If using paste, allow it to dry and try to scrape the glue from the concrete again.

steps.headline: Scrub the floor with TSP a second time.
Rinse the floor with clean water to remove any remaining cleaning compounds.
Use a shop vac to dry your concrete, if necessary.

text: Buy some trisodium phosphate (TSP). This chemical is particularly useful for cleaning concrete. Sweep your concrete floor with a shop broom, gathering up as much dirt and debris as possible.  Scrub your floor with the TSP. Use a rotary scrubbing machine with a special pad designed for the aggressive scrubbing of concrete. Look for remaining stains, such as those left behind by glues or caulking compounds.  Attempt to scrape any of the glue or caulk off of the floor with a putty knife or floor scraper.  If scraping alone does not work, apply either a nonflammable chemical stripper or a powdered hydrated lime paste to the stained area. If using paste, allow it to dry and try to scrape the glue from the concrete again. Scrub the floor with TSP a second time.  Rinse the floor with clean water to remove any remaining cleaning compounds.  Use a shop vac to dry your concrete, if necessary.
